intro: Oreocharis rosthornii var. crenulata, commonly known as the crested oreocharis, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and delicate, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, preferring cool and humid conditions. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
